result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea date on November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:03 PM Defendant Matthew S. Pribek in court.  Attorney Ann M. Larson in court for Matthew S. Pribek.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Inducement made.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch  for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Offer deadline is set for August 19, 2022.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:32 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew S. Pribek appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Harrison in court for Matthew S. Pribek. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew S. Pribek
Current: n/a,   (Effective: 06-30-2022)
Prior: 1942 Ravenswood Ln, Manitowoc, WI 54220

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess methamphetamine, possess Fentanyl and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 07-11-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he provide an address to the Clerk of Court office, in writing, within 24 hours of release and that he maintain absolute sobriety. Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
